name: Software Testing
description: The software testing course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of the principles and techniques used in software testing. It covers the different types of testing, such as functional, performance, and security testing, and teaches students how to plan, design, and execute tests effectively. The course is designed to equip aspiring testers with the skills and knowledge needed to ensure the quality of software applications.
workOne: As a Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst, it would be your job to make sure that software products are good in general.
workTwo: Test Automation Engineers are in charge of automating test processes to make them more accurate and efficient.

topics.name: Module 1: Software Testing Fundamentals
subtopics: Testing Environments and Tools
Manual vs Automation Testing
Software Requirements and Architectural Design
Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC)

topics.name: Module 2: Manual Testing
subtopics: Testing Techniques and Types of Testing
Test Plan, Test Strategy, and Test Case
Defect Life Cycle and Bug Tracking using JIRA
Basic SQL Concepts and Hands-on Experience with JIRA

topics.name: Module 3: Java Basics
subtopics: Introduction to Java and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
Class, Object, Constructor, and Method
Variables, Operators, and Data Types
Control Statements, Loops, and Strings

topics.name: Module 4: Advanced Java Concepts
subtopics: Access Modifiers, Inheritance, and Polymorphism
Method Overloading, Parameters, and Return Types
Arrays, Java Collections, and Generics
Exception Handling and Best Practices

topics.name: Module 5: Selenium Automation Testing
subtopics: Introduction to Selenium and its Features/Variants
WebDriver Interface and Architecture
Automation Test Environment Setup using Maven and POM
Web Element Locators and Selenium Commands

topics.name: Module 6: Cucumber BDD Framework
subtopics: Introduction to Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) and Cucumber
Gherkin Language, Feature, and Feature File
Step Definitions, Hooks, and Test Runners
Integrating Cucumber with Selenium and Testing

topics.name: Module 7: Selenium and Cucumber Project
subtopics: Building a Real-Time Industry Framework from Scratch
Writing BDD Test Cases and Executing using Selenium and Cucumber
Handling Web Elements, Alerts, Frames, and Windows
Best Practices and Test Reporting using Jenkins and Git

topics.name: Module 8: Cloud Applications and Interview Preparation
subtopics: Distributed Version Control using Git and GitHub
Continuous Integration and Deployment (CI/CD) using Jenkins
Overview of when to use different types of associations in web development projects
End-to-End API Testing using Postman

name: Cyber Security
description: The goal of our Cyber Security course is to teach you everything you need to know about protecting digital systems, networks, and data against cyber threats. The course covers a wide range of topics, such as risk assessment, threat modeling, vulnerability management, network security, cryptography, incident response, and more.Our professional teachers will walk you through real-world scenarios and case studies to help you learn skills that you can use at work. You will also get hands-on experience with tools and tactics used by the business to protect against cyber assaults.
workOne: A cyber engineer is the key information and internet security magician for any company. Personal information like bank accounts can be lost by being a little careless or not making the right plans. Because of this, companies all over the world are hiring more people to work on safety. So, if you take a Cybersecurity training, a skilled ethical hacker or Cyber Security Specialist can work remotely at any company outside of the country or country. In this way, the Nexttech ITC Institute's Career Placement Department is a big help to pupils.
workTwo: At the moment, cyber experts are taking a chance on freelancing so they can work when they want and make a good living. Every day, there are a lot of cybersecurity jobs posted on sites like Freelancer.com, Fiverr, Upwork, Hacker One, Bugcrowd, and Open Bug Bounty by people from all over the world. So if you know a lot about IT security or are a good hacker, you can also be a great freelancer.

topics.name: Module 1: Introduction
subtopics: Overview of cyber security
Prerequisites for this course
Course objectives
Importance of cyber security

topics.name: Module 2: Basic Hacking Terms
subtopics: Hacker types and techniques
White, Grey, and Black Hat Hackers
Common Hacking Techniques
Importance of Understanding Hacking Terminology

topics.name: Module 3: Environment Setup
subtopics: Introduction to Environment Setup
Virtual Box and VMware
BIOS Setup
Importance of Environment Setup

topics.name: Module 4: Information Gathering
subtopics: Introduction & Importance  of Information Gathering
Obtaining IP and Physical Addresses
Whatweb Stealthy Scan and Gathering Emails
Finding Usernames with Sherlock

topics.name: Module 5: Scanning
subtopics: TCP and UDP Scanning with Netdiscover
Scanning with Nmap
Filtering Port Range and Output of Scan Results with Nmap
Decoys and Packet Fragmentation with Nmap

topics.name: Module 6: Threat and vulnerability analysis
subtopics: Introduction to Threat and Vulnerability Analysis
Common Threats
Trust and Backdoors
Importance of Threat and Vulnerability Analysis

topics.name: Module 7: Encryption
subtopics: Introduction to Cryptography
Types of Encryption
SSL and TLS
End-to-End Encryption and Steganography

topics.name: Module 8: Operating System Security
subtopics: Windows 10 Privacy
Pure Security-Focused Operating Systems
Anonymity-Focused Operating Systems

topics.name: Module 9: Security Bugs And vulnerabilities
subtopics: Operating System Patching
Browser Extension Updates
Risks of Delaying Updates
Best Practices for Updating

topics.name: Module 10: Social Engineering attack and remedy
subtopics: Identity Verification and Registration
Behavioural Security Control against Social Threats
Technical Security Control against Social Threats
Security Culture and Awareness

topics.name: Module 11: Web Application penetration testing
subtopics: Web Application Scanning
Exploitation Technique
Hydra Brute-Force
Best Practices for Web Application Security

topics.name: Module 12: Gaining Access to android devices
subtopics: Android Virtual Machine Installation
Gaining Access with Android Meterpreter

name: Full Stack Web Development
description: In this exciting course, you'll discover the fundamental building blocks of web development, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. From there, you'll explore cutting-edge tools and frameworks like React, Node.js, and MongoDB to create stunning, interactive web applications. With our expert guidance, you'll develop the skills and knowledge needed to build your own dynamic web projects from scratch!
workOne: Web development agencies and companies that build and manage websites and web apps are always looking for full stack developers. Most of the time, these groups need developers who can work on both the client-side (frontend) and server-side (backend) of a project. As a full stack developer in this area, you can help build web projects from start to finish, making sure that the frontend and backend parts work well together.
workTwo: Full stack writers are often valued by startups, especially those with few resources because they can do a lot of different things. Startups usually need developers who can handle a wide range of tasks, such as creating user interfaces and building a solid server infrastructure. As a full stack developer in a startup, you can have a big effect on the development of the product by working on different technologies and working closely with the team to deliver features quickly and iterate.

topics.name: Module 1: Introduction To Web Development
subtopics: Web development refers to the creation and maintenance of websites and web applications.
HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are the basic building blocks of a web page.
HTML is used to create the structure of a web page, CSS is used to style it, and JavaScript is used to add interactivity.
Understanding web development is important for creating engaging and functional websites.

topics.name: Module 2: Setting up the Development Environment
subtopics: Setting up a development environment involves installing the necessary software and tools required for web development.
JavaScript, React, Node.js, and MongoDB are commonly used technologies in web development.
The installation of dependencies and tools is necessary to ensure that the development environment is functional and stable.
Having a properly configured development environment is essential for efficient and effective web development.

topics.name: Module 3: HTML, CSS
subtopics: HTML is a markup language used for creating the structure and content of a web page.
The basic syntax and structure of HTML involve using tags to define elements on a web page
CSS is a styling language used for creating the visual layout of a web page.
Common HTML tags and CSS properties are essential for designing and formatting a web page.

topics.name: Module 4: Bootstrap
subtopics: Bootstrap is a popular front-end development framework used for designing responsive and mobile-first websites
Bootstrap provides a library of CSS styles and pre-built components that can be used to speed up development
Including Bootstrap in a web page involves adding the framework's CSS and JavaScript files to the HTML
Knowing how to use Bootstrap can help streamline the development process and create visually appealing websites.

topics.name: Module 5: Tailwind
subtopics: Tailwind is a utility-first CSS framework used for quickly and efficiently designing and building custom user interfaces.
Tailwind provides a comprehensive set of pre-defined utility classes that can be used to style HTML elements.
Including Tailwind in a web page involves adding the framework's CSS file to the HTML.
Knowing how to use Tailwind can help speed up the development process and create consistent and responsive user interfaces.

topics.name: Module 6: JavaScript
subtopics: JavaScript is a programming language used to add interactivity to web pages.
The basic syntax and structure of JavaScript involve using variables, functions, and control flow statements to manipulate data and respond to events.
JavaScript can be used for creating animations, validating form inputs, and interacting with APIs, among other things.
Understanding JavaScript is essential for creating dynamic and interactive web pages.

topics.name: Module 7: Advanced JavaScript
subtopics: Advanced programming concepts in JavaScript include working with arrays, objects, and loops.
The Document Object Model (DOM) is a programming interface for interacting with HTML and CSS using JavaScript.
Manipulating the DOM using JavaScript allows for dynamically updating and changing the content and style of a web page.
Knowing advanced JavaScript concepts can help create more complex and feature-rich web applications.

topics.name: Module 8: React
subtopics: React is a popular JavaScript library used for building user interfaces.
Setting up a React project involves installing the necessary dependencies and configuring the development environment.
React is based on the concept of components, which are reusable pieces of code that can be used to build complex user interfaces.
Understanding React is essential for building scalable and efficient web applications.

topics.name: Module 9: Advanced JavaScript
subtopics: Advanced React concepts such as hooks, lifecycle methods, and conditional rendering.
Introduction to popular React libraries such as React Router and Redux.
How to handle forms and user input in React using controlled components.
Best practices for managing state and designing reusable components in React.

topics.name: Module 10: Node.js
subtopics: Overview of Node.js, its features, and how it works.
How to create a server with Node.js and use the core modules to interact with the file system and network.
How to use the Express.js framework to create a RESTful API, handle routing, and implement middleware.
Introduction to server-side templating and using third-party modules with Node.js.

topics.name: Module 11: MongoDB
subtopics: Overview of MongoDB and how it differs from traditional relational databases.
How to create, read, update, and delete data in MongoDB using the Query API.
Working with MongoDB drivers for Node.js and connecting to a database from a Node.js application.
Introduction to data modeling in MongoDB and best practices for structuring data.

topics.name: Module 12: Introduction to Sequelize ORM and MySQL
subtopics: Basic concepts of Sequelize ORM and how it simplifies database access in Node.js applications.
How to connect Sequelize with a MySQL database and define database models.
Performing CRUD (create, read, update, delete) operations on a MySQL database using Sequelize.
Introduction to data migrations and seeding data in a Sequelize and MySQL project.

topics.name: Module 13: Creating Database Models
subtopics: How to define database models in Sequelize and the different data types that can be used.
Defining relationships between database models using Sequelize associations.
Using Sequelize to create, read, update, and delete data from a database.
Introduction to Sequelize hooks and instance methods for adding custom logic to model operations.

topics.name: Module 14: Defining Associations Between Models
subtopics: Types of associations in Sequelize and when to use them (one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-many).
How to define associations between models using Sequelize and create queries with associations.
Best practices for designing database models with associations in Sequelize.
Introduction to Sequelize migrations for modifying database schemas and data with code.

name: Graphic Design
description: Graphic design is an essential aspect of modern communication. It involves the use of visual elements to convey information, ideas, and emotions. Whether it's creating logos, posters, social media graphics, or book covers, graphic design plays a critical role in shaping how we perceive and interact with the world around us. This course provides an introduction to the theory and practice of graphic design, with a focus on Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign. Students will learn essential design skills, tools, and techniques, as well as how to apply them to various projects.
workOne: A graphic designer is the artist who makes banners and posters. He or she starts by making a company's logo. So, the job of graphic design continues to grow in many companies around the world. So, if you've taken an Advanced Graphic Design training, you can get a remote job at any company in or out of the country. In this way, students are helped by the Career Placement Department of the Nexttech ITC
workTwo: One study found that about 57% of people who work in the art and design fields are self-employed. Because a worker can also make a good living while working on their own. Graphic design jobs from all over the world are posted every day on different platforms, such as Fiverr, Upwork, and Legit. You can do well as a freelancer even if you are a graphic artist.

topics.name: Module 1: Graphic Design Theory
subtopics: Understanding typography basics, color theory, and layout theory.
Learning about different types of grids and how they can be used in design.
Understanding the importance of visual hierarchy and how it can be achieved.
Learning about the different types of design styles and when to use them.

topics.name: Module 2: Adobe Photoshop Introduction and Tools
subtopics: Understanding the basic setup of Photoshop and its interface.
Learning how to use and manipulate images using basic tools like the Content Aware Tool and Layering Masks.
Understanding the use of Duotones, Gradients, and other color effects in design
Learning advanced editing techniques like non-destructive editing and changing hair/object color.

topics.name: Module 3: Photoshop Editing and Manipulation
subtopics: Understanding the process of photo editing and manipulation using Photoshop.
Learning advanced techniques like object color and hair color changing.
Understanding the importance of non-destructive editing in preserving image quality.
Learning how to create professional-quality images using advanced editing tools.

topics.name: Module 4: PROJECT - YouTube Thumbnail
subtopics: Understanding the design requirements for a YouTube thumbnail.
Learning how to use layering masks, typography tools, and other design elements to create an effective thumbnail.
Understanding the importance of visual hierarchy in a thumbnail design.
Putting the skills learned in previous modules to use by creating a professional-quality YouTube thumbnail.

topics.name: Module 5: PROJECT - A Full Book Cover Design
subtopics: Understanding the design requirements for a book cover
Learning how to use advanced Photoshop tools to create complex design elements.
Understanding the importance of visual hierarchy and layout theory in a book cover design.
Putting the skills learned in previous modules to use by creating a professional-quality book cover.

topics.name: Module 6: Adobe Illustrator Introduction and Basic Tools
subtopics: Understanding the basics of vector graphics and their applications in design.
Learning the basic tools of Illustrator, including the Pen Tool and Shapebuilder Tool.
Understanding how to use grids and other tools to create complex vector shapes.
Learning how to create professional-quality vector graphics using Illustrator.

topics.name: Module 7: PROJECT - Create a vector illustration
subtopics: Understanding the design requirements for a vector illustration.
Learning how to create complex vector shapes using advanced Illustrator tools.
Understanding the importance of color theory and other design principles in a vector illustration.
Putting the skills learned in previous modules to use by creating a professional-quality vector illustration.

topics.name: Module 8: Logo Design & Branding Theory
subtopics: Understanding the basics of logo design and its importance in branding.
Learning about different types of logos and their applications in branding.
Understanding the importance of color theory and typography in logo design.
Learning how to create a professional-quality logo design that effectively represents a brand.

topics.name: Module 9: PROJECT - Logo design projects
subtopics: Understanding the design requirements for creating logos for personal and commercial use.
Learning how to use advanced tools and techniques to create professional-quality logos.
Understanding the importance of branding and visual identity in logo design.
Putting the skills learned in previous modules to use by creating professional-quality logos for personal and commercial use.

topics.name: Module 10: Layout Practice - Event Flyer Design
subtopics: Understanding the design requirements for an event flyer/poster.
Learning how to create effective headlines and use type hierarchy in design.
Understanding the importance of layout theory and best practices in flyer design.
Putting the skills learned in previous modules to use by creating a professional-quality event flyer/poster

topics.name: Module 11: Adobe InDesign
subtopics: Introduction to InDesign and its basic tools
Working with type and paragraph tools to format text
Master Pages and its use in creating consistent layout and design
Working with spreads, character and paragraph styles, and color palettes to create visually appealing documents

topics.name: Module 12: Advanced InDesign Techniques
subtopics: Advanced text formatting techniques such as nested styles, GREP, and tables
Working with images and graphics in InDesign
Creating interactive documents with InDesign
Preparing documents for print or digital output

name: Front End Development
description: Welcome to our Frontend Web Development Course! In this course, we will guide you through the fundamentals of web development, starting with the basic building blocks of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. We'll cover setting up your development environment, including installation of required dependencies and tools. You'll learn about popular frameworks like Bootstrap and Tailwind, and delve into more advanced programming concepts such as loops, objects, and the Document Object Model (DOM).
workOne: You could also work for yourself or do freelance work to make a good living. Every day, people from all over the world post a lot of web development jobs on platforms like Freelancer.com, Upwork, and ThemeForest. You can also do well as an independent if you learn skills in this area.
workTwo: On BdJobs or LinkedIn, there are a lot of jobs related to React that come from outside the country or country every day. So, if you take a Front End Development with React course, you can work as a skilled web developer from anywhere in the world at any place. In this way, students are helped by the Career Placement Department of the Nexttech ITC

name: Backend Development
description: This Backend web development course covers the essential skills and knowledge required to build web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, MongoDB, and Sequelize ORM. Students will learn how to create responsive web pages, set up a development environment, work with databases, and implement user authentication and authorization. The course includes hands-on exercises and projects to help students gain practical experience in web development. By the end of the course, students will be able to build functional web applications from scratch.
workOne: Every day, people from outside the country or country post web development jobs on BD Jobs or LinkedIn. So, if you take a training in web development, you can work as a skilled web developer from anywhere in the world for any company. In this way, students are helped by the Career Placement Department of the Nexttech ITC
workTwo: You could also work for yourself or do freelance work to make a good living. Every day, people from all over the world post a lot of web development jobs on platforms like Freelancer.com, Upwork, and ThemeForest. You can also do well as an independent if you learn skills in this area.

name: UI UX Design Course For Beginners
description: In this course, you will learn the fundamentals of user interface and user experience design. You will gain a strong understanding of user-centered design principles and processes, and develop skills in user research, information architecture, interaction design, visual design, and usability testing. Through hands-on projects and exercises, you will learn how to create effective and engaging designs for websites, mobile apps, and other digital products. By the end of the course, you will have a strong portfolio of work and the skills to succeed in the exciting field of UI/UX design.
workOne: UX/UI designers create company websites, apps, banners, and posters. As a result, many domestic and international firms need UX/UI design work. You can work as a UX/UI designer in any company, locally or overseas, after completing a course. Nexttech ITC Institute's Career Placement Department helps students find suitable jobs.
workTwo: 57% of artists and designers are freelancers, according to a poll. Freelancers can work autonomously and earn well. UX/UI tasks from around the world appear on Fiverr, Upwork, ThemeForest, and others daily. UX/UI designers can freelance successfully.

name: Freelancing
description: This freelancing course is designed to equip aspiring freelancers with the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in the growing industry. It covers the advantages and disadvantages of freelancing, different types of freelancing, getting started as a freelancer, finding freelance work, managing freelance projects, building a sustainable freelance business, and avoiding burnout.
workOne: Fiverr is an online marketplace that connects freelancers with clients worldwide. It provides a streamlined process for communication, project management, and secure payment transactions, making it a popular choice for both freelancers and clients. Upwork is an online marketplace that connects businesses and clients with freelancers from around the world.
workTwo: Upwork is an online marketplace connecting businesses and clients with freelancers from around the world, offering tools for communication, collaboration, project management, time tracking, payment protection, and dispute resolution.

name: Mobile Testing(APPIUM)
description: This comprehensive mobile testing (Appium) course covers all the essential skills and knowledge needed to automate native and hybrid apps, browser apps, and mobile gestures. You will also learn how to design and implement industry-standard frameworks using Appium, TestNG, Maven, Jenkins, GitHub, Apache Log4J2, and Extent Reports, as well as how to integrate your framework with CI/CD and automate testing on the cloud.
workOne: As a Mobile QA Tester, your job would be to test mobile apps on different systems, like Android and iOS, using Appium and other tools. You would be in charge of making test cases, running test scripts, finding and reporting bugs, and making sure that mobile apps are high-quality and work well. Mobile QA testers work closely with development teams and partners to test how well an app works, how the user feels about it, and if it works with other apps.
workTwo: Test Automation Engineers are in charge of making and keeping up-to-date automated test scripts and systems for mobile apps. With your knowledge of Appium, you can automate test cases, add them to continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, and make sure that testing processes are efficient and reliable. Test Automation Engineers work with teams from different departments to find opportunities for automating tests, improve test coverage, and improve the testing approach as a whole.

topics.name: Module 1: Introduction to Appium
subtopics: Overview of Appium features
Appium internal architecture
Installation and setup for running tests on Android and iOS simulators/emulators
Installation and setup for running tests on Android and iOS real devices

topics.name: Module 2: Native App Automation with Appium
subtopics: Understanding native app automation

name: CCNA - Cisco Certified Network Associate
description: CCNA is mostly a training program for people who want to work with computer networks or start a job in the networking industry. Having a CCNA diploma in the networking field makes you qualified for any entry-level job in the field. So the CCNA Certification from Nexttech ITC will help you lay the groundwork for your IT job. CCNA is the first step toward getting other Cisco certifications.
workOne: Every day, people from outside the country or country look for networking jobs on BDI Jobs or LinkedIn. If you take the CCNA training, you can work as a Network Specialist for any company.
workTwo: You could also work for yourself or do freelance work to make a good living. Cisco CCNA works every day on many different markets, such as Freelancer.com, Fiverr, and Upwork, from all over the world. You can also do well as an independent if you learn skills in this area.
